intro: Pedicularis elwesii var. major, commonly known as the large yellow lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine habitats. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
